content: When was Sachin Tendulkar born?
Sachin Tendulkar was born on April 24, 1973.
What were some of the nicknames given to Sachin Tendulkar?
Some of the nicknames given to Sachin Tendulkar include the 'Master Blaster,' the 'Little Master,' and 'God of Cricket.'
How did Sachin Tendulkar first get introduced to cricket?
Sachin Tendulkar was first introduced to cricket by his elder brother Ajit.
At what age did Sachin Tendulkar make his international debut?
Sachin Tendulkar made his international debut for India at the tender age of sixteen, against Pakistan in 1989.
What are some of Sachin Tendulkar's notable achievements in his cricket career?

Throughout his illustrious career, Sachin Tendulkar shattered numerous records, setting benchmarks that seemed insurmountable. From becoming the first player to score one hundred international centuries to amassing over 34,000 runs in international cricket, his statistical achievements are staggering. Some of his notable achievements include:
- Scoring a double century against South Africa in 1999, which is still considered one of the greatest innings in cricketing history.
- Aggregating 2,845 runs in a single Test series against Australia in 2003-04, breaking the previous record held by Brian Lara.
- Being the first player to score 100 runs in both innings of a Test match, which he achieved against Pakistan in 2004.
- Winning five World Cups with India - 1996, 1999, 2003, 2007, and 2011.
How did Sachin Tendulkar influence the game of cricket beyond his performances on the field?

Sachin Tendulkar's influence extends far beyond the cricket pitch, inspiring millions to pursue their dreams with passion and perseverance. His philanthropic endeavors, including his contributions to healthcare and education, further underscore his commitment to making a positive impact on society.
When did Sachin Tendulkar retire from international cricket?
Sachin Tendulkar retired from international cricket on October 15, 2013.
What is Sachin Tendulkar’s legacy in cricket?

Sachin Tendulkar’s legacy in cricket is one of unparalleled achievements, unwavering commitment, and enduring influence. His impact on the sport extends far beyond the cricket pitch, inspiring millions to pursue their dreams with passion and perseverance. Tendulkar’s philanthropic endeavors, including his contributions to healthcare and education, further underscore his commitment to making a positive impact on society. Despite retiring from international cricket in 2013, Tendulkar continues to thrive as he remains actively involved in promoting the sport and mentoring young talent. His journey from a young boy with a dream to a cricketing icon serves as a testament to the power of determination and hard work, earning him a permanent place in the annals of cricketing history.
How did Sachin Tendulkar’s coach, Ramakant Achrekar, contribute to his success?

Ramakant Achrekar played a pivotal role in nurturing Sachin Tendulkar’s skills during his formative years. He honed his batting technique and developed a deep understanding of the game’s nuances under Achrekar’s guidance.
What has Sachin Tendulkar been involved with after his retirement?

After retiring from international cricket in 2013, Sachin Tendulkar has remained actively involved in promoting the sport and mentoring young talent. He continues to be a cricketing icon and serves as a testament to the power of determination and hard work. Additionally, he has been involved in philanthropic endeavors, including contributions to healthcare and education, further underscoring his commitment to making a positive impact on society.
when was sachin born?
Sachin Ramesh Tendulkar was born on April 24, 1973.
